name: Baitulmaal, Inc.
mission: Baitulmaal provides life-saving, life-sustaining, and life-enriching humanitarian aid to under-served populations around the world regardless of faith or nationality. Baitulmaal serves as a conduit between the compassion of our donors and the needs of their beneficiaries. We turn compassion into hope for those in need.
theoryOfChange: Baitulmaal acts as a conduit between donor compassion and beneficiary needs through a three-pillar approach: Respond (emergency), Sustain (basic needs), and Thrive (education/economic development).

evaluationSources: Gates Foundation (supported maternity unit in Somalia)

zakatClaimEvidence: Organization name implies zakat acceptance ('baitulmaal') (Source: https://www.baitulmaal.org/donate)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 41/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

score_details.score_summary: Baitulmaal, Inc. shows strong alignment and good impact, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Organization name implies zakat acceptance ('baitulmaal') (Source: https://www.baitulmaal.org/donate)

all_citations.claim: Baitulmaal holds a 99.0/100 score and holds 10.0 months of working capital.
The organization is zakat-eligible and follows specific zakat policies.
Total revenue was $23,687,125 with a program expense ratio of 93.6% and fundraising efficiency of $0.10 per $1 raised.
Baitulmaal provides tools for healthy, educated, and empowered lives through disaster relief and orphan sponsorship.
The charity offers various donation options for humanitarian aid and orphan care.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Baitulmaal earns a strong overall rating due to its high financial efficiency and clear alignment with humanitarian needs. While its financial health is excellent, there is room to improve the directness and cost-efficiency of its impact metrics.
areas_for_improvement: Enhancing direct impact metrics to lower the cost per beneficiary for long-term programs.
Expanding public reporting on specific outcome data for sustainable development projects.

dimension_explanations.alignment: Baitulmaal shows high alignment for Muslim donors as a ZAKAT-ELIGIBLE organization that provides specific tools for zakat calculation and distribution [2][4]. Its focus on urgent humanitarian causes and orphan sponsorship aligns with high-priority donor values [5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a solid impact through direct service delivery in disaster relief and orphan care, though its cost per beneficiary is calculated at approximately 974.07 [1]. It maintains a high program expense ratio of 93.6%, indicating that nearly all revenue is directed toward its core mission [3].

baseline_narrative.headline: Baitulmaal, Inc. provides high-impact humanitarian aid and sustainable development to vulnerable populations globally while maintaining exceptional financial transparency.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 93.6%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach those in need.
Strong financial health with 10.0 months of working capital and high fundraising efficiency of $0.10 per $1 raised.
Zakat-eligible status with clear policies for donors to fulfill their religious obligations.
baseline_narrative.summary: Baitulmaal, Inc. is a humanitarian organization dedicated to providing disaster relief, orphan sponsorship, and sustainable development tools to help individuals lead productive lives [4]. The organization reported a total revenue of $23,687,125 and maintains a high level of financial accountability with a Charity Navigator score of 99.0/100 [1][3].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Baitulmaal earns a strong overall rating due to its high financial efficiency and clear alignment with humanitarian needs. While its financial health is excellent, there is room to improve the directness and cost-efficiency of its impact metrics.

areas_for_improvement.context: While impact is verified, the organization could benefit from <cite id="13">documenting a clearer theory of change</cite> with explicit causal pathways.
The current <cite id="14">board size of 4 members</cite> is considered minimal for an organization of this revenue scale.

bbb_assessment.summary: Organizational data is primarily verified through Charity Navigator and Candid Platinum disclosure.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The high cost per beneficiary is often tied to intensive direct services like healthcare and orphan sponsorship rather than simple commodity distribution.
risk_factors: <cite id="18">3-year revenue CAGR of -15.6%</cite> indicates a contraction in funding
<cite id="16">Cost per beneficiary of $974.07</cite> is higher than some humanitarian peers
case_against.summary: The primary considerations involve <cite id="16">higher-than-average costs per beneficiary</cite> and a <cite id="18">recent decline in revenue growth</cite>.

confidence.notes: Strong financial and transparency data available.

alignment.explanation: Strong fit for Muslim donors with <cite id="9">verified zakat eligibility</cite> serving the <cite id="9">fuqara and masakin</cite> in high-urgency humanitarian zones.
alignment.improvement: The charity could further improve alignment by <cite id="17">expanding services to additional underserved geographies</cite> with limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its <cite id="5">99.0/100 from Charity Navigator rating</cite> and <cite id="12">93.6% independent board governance</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the charity could <cite id="14">expand its board of directors</cite> beyond the current four members to increase oversight diversity.

impact.explanation: Operations are highly efficient with a <cite id="3">93.6% program expense ratio</cite> and <cite id="11">10.0 months of resilient working capital</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="13">publishing a formal theory of change</cite> to better communicate long-term outcomes.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade B - Verified outcomes with Platinum transparency

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct service delivery rather than grantmaking

rich_narrative.headline: Baitulmaal, Inc. provides high-impact humanitarian aid and sustainable development to vulnerable populations globally while maintaining exceptional financial transparency.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to fulfill zakat obligations through a highly transparent, Muslim-led organization that prioritizes direct aid in major conflict zones.
donor_motivations: Want to ensure 93.6% of their donation reaches program services
Value high-level transparency seals and independent ratings
Prioritize aid to Gaza, Palestine, and Yemen
Seek to fulfill zakat through verified asnaf categories
giving_considerations: The organization is currently in a revenue contraction phase
Focus is on direct service delivery rather than advocacy
Board size is smaller than typical for this revenue tier
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking organizations with extensive academic RCT evidence or those looking for domestic US-based advocacy programs.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Verified outcomes and Platinum-level transparency, though formal theory of change documentation is still developing.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Baitulmaal provides immediate relief and sustainable tools to empower vulnerable populations toward healthy and productive lives.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that direct service delivery effectively transitions from emergency relief to long-term empowerment.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="18">-15.6% revenue CAGR</cite>, the organization has significant capacity to absorb new funding to return to previous operational scales.

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: Palestine, Gaza, Afghanistan, Pakistan, Sudan, Somalia, Kenya, Uganda, Yemen, Syria

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by a <cite id="3">93.6% program expense ratio</cite> which is significantly higher than the <cite id="19">peer median of 89.8%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on humanitarian relief and orphan care at a similar scale.

strengths.detail: The organization directs a <cite id="3">93.6% program expense ratio</cite> toward its core mission, ensuring maximum impact for every dollar donated.
Baitulmaal maintains a <cite id="5">99/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and a <cite id="7">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>.
The charity provides a <cite id="8">specialized zakat calculator</cite> and ensures funds are distributed among <cite id="9">eligible asnaf categories including the poor and needy</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: Baitulmaal's operational strength is rooted in its lean financial model, which achieves a <cite id="10">fundraising efficiency of $0.10 per $1 raised</cite>. This efficiency allows the organization to maintain <cite id="11">10.0 months of working capital</cite>, providing a significant buffer for emergency rapid-response scenarios. Their governance is marked by a <cite id="12">93.6% independent board</cite>, which oversees a diverse portfolio of programs ranging from <cite id="6">orphan care to healthcare infrastructure</cite> in high-conflict zones like Syria and Somalia.
rich_narrative.summary: Baitulmaal, Inc. is a global humanitarian organization that provides disaster relief, orphan sponsorship, and sustainable development tools to vulnerable populations across <cite id="1">Palestine, Gaza, Afghanistan, Pakistan, and Yemen</cite>. The organization operates with a high degree of financial efficiency, reporting <cite id="2">$23,687,125 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 fiscal year. A defining characteristic of Baitulmaal is its commitment to direct service delivery, maintaining a <cite id="3">93.6% program expense ratio</cite> according to recent financial filings, which significantly exceeds the <cite id="4">industry standard of 75%</cite>. This fiscal discipline is further validated by a <cite id="5">99/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting top-tier performance in accountability and finance. Beyond emergency response, the charity manages <cite id="6">WASH programs, healthcare initiatives, and food distribution</cite> to foster long-term resilience in crisis-affected regions. The organization also maintains a <cite id="7">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, the highest level of disclosure available, ensuring donors have access to comprehensive organizational data.
